dataIdInfo.idAbs: Use this tool to generate the 3D City Information Model (3DCIM) database schema or parts of it.

tool.name: SchemaGenerator
tool.toolboxalias: ArcGIS for 3D Cities Database Schema Tools

param.name: configuration_files_location
param.dialogReference: Path to the folder where the 3DCIM configuration files are stored.
param.pythonReference: Path to the folder where the 3DCIM configuration files are stored.

param.name: in_gdb
param.dialogReference: The Geodatabase workspace in which the 3DCIM schema is to be generated.
param.pythonReference: The Geodatabase workspace in which the 3DCIM schema is to be generated.

param.name: spatial_reference
param.dialogReference: The spatial reference system to be used for all Feature Classes in the 3DCIM geodatabase.
param.pythonReference: The spatial reference system to be used for all Feature Classes in the 3DCIM geodatabase.

param.name: generate_classes
param.expression: {SpatialVolumeAnnotation | SpatialPointAnnotation | SpatialAreaAnnotation | SpatialLineAnnotation | Building | BuildingEntrancePoint | BuildingShell | BuildingShellPart | SupportingStructure | Fence | BuildingInteriorSpace | BuildingFloor | BuildingInteriorStructure | InteriorInstallation | StreetFurniture | Sensor | SensorCoverage | Sign | Tree | ZoningDistrict | Parcel | LandCover | AdministrativeDistrict | TransportNetworkSegment}
param.dialogReference: Select the classes you want to have generated by this script.
param.pythonReference: Select the classes you want to have generated by this script.

param.name: generate_tables
param.dialogReference: Select the tables you want to have generated by this script.
param.pythonReference: Select the tables you want to have generated by this script.

param.name: generate_relationships
param.expression: {BuildingHasEntrance | BuildingHasShell | BuildingHasShellPart | BuildingHasSpace | BuildingHasFloor | FloorHasSpace | FloorHasStructure | SensorHasCoverage | SpaceHasInstallation | SpaceHasUsage | ZoneHasRegulation | ZoneHasUsage | ParcelHasRegulation | ParcelHasNeigborhood | ParcelHasUsage}
param.dialogReference: Select the relationship classes you want to have generated by this script. Note that the source and target feature classes must have been selected in the inputs above, otherwise creation of the relationship classes will fail.
param.pythonReference: Select the relationship classes you want to have generated by this script. Note that the source and target feature classes must have been selected in the inputs above, otherwise creation of the relationship classes will fail.

param.name: generate_domains
param.expression: {AccessType | AnnotationType | Boolean | BuildingInteriorSpaceType | BuildingInteriorStructureType | BuildingRoofForm | BuildingUsage | BuildingType | ConstructionStatus | InteriorInstallationType | LandCoverType | ParcelType | PlanType | SensorType | ShellPartType | StreetFurnitureType | TreeCanopyShape | TreeGenusType | TreeSpeciesType | ZoningUsageType | CityFabricRelationType | FlowDirection | RegulationOperator | RegulationAspect | RegulationType | TransectType | RegulationBlockType | RegulationFootprintType | RegulationFootprintAlignmentType | Unit | VerticalExtentType | DirectionType | PavementType | TransportSegmentType | SegmentNameDirection | SegmentNameGeneric | AdministrativeDistrictType | NutsCode}
param.dialogReference: Select the domains and coded values you want to have generated by this script. Note if you decided to generate only a subset of domains, the creation of tables and feature classes may fail, as these depend on complete domains.
param.pythonReference: Select the domains and coded values you want to have generated by this script. Note if you decided to generate only a subset of domains, the creation of tables and feature classes may fail, as these depend on complete domains.

tool.summary: Use this tool to generate the 3D City Information Model (3DCIM) database schema or parts of it.
tool.usage: Create an empty File Geodatabase, run this tool, select the new File Geodatabase and fill in the parameters.
